title: View from the Pont Transbordeur
titles: View from the Pont Transbordeur, Marseilles
description: De foto is een bijna abstracte compositie van de metalen constructie, de betonnen pijler en het driehoekige zeil van een schip. Alleen van dichtbij is er enige figuratie te zien: de man in het zeilschip.

acquisition.creditLine: Purchased with the support of Baker McKenzie and the Vereniging Rembrandt, with additional funding from the Prins Bernhard Cultuurfonds

documentation: Mattie Boom en Hans Rooseboom, 'Modern Times : Een lange eeuw in tien delen', Fotografisch Geheugen (2014), 84, p. 8, afb. 11.
Mattie Boom en Hans Rooseboom, 'Gezicht vanaf de Pont Transbordeur, Marseille', Bulletin van de Vereniging Rembrandt 20 (2010) nr. 3, p. 26-29.
longTitle: View from the Pont Transbordeur, László Moholy-Nagy, 1929
subTitle: h 389mm × w 278mm
scLabelLine: László Moholy-Nagy (1895-1946), gelatin silver print, Marseille, 1929

label.title: View from the Pont Transbordeur
label.makerLine: László Moholy-Nagy (1895-1946), gelatin silver print, Marseille, 1929
label.description: This may well be the penultimate example of Modernism as expressed in photography in the 1920s. Moholy-Nagy climbed to the top of the Marseille transporter bridge and photographed straight down. The rhythm of the metal construction, printed dark, contrasts with the circular concrete pillar. Two triangular sails of a ship passing by prevent the photograph from turning into an entirely abstract entity.
